intro: Cynoglossum officinale subvar. bicolor, commonly known as the blueweed or twinflower, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It belongs to the Boraginaceae family and is characterized by its striking blue or purple flowers that bloom in late summer. The plant typically grows to a height of about 30–60 cm and has hairy, lance-shaped leaves. It thrives in well-drained soil and full sun, often found in meadows and along roadsides. The flowers are tubular and attract pollinators such as bees and butterflies.
